q: Mr David Cameron told the BBC that he believed Mr Andy Coulson had already made amends for`` bad things'' that happened during his editorship, and insisted that the communications chief deserved a second chance. I always think that the danger at the moment is that he is effectively being punished twice for the same offence, he said.`` I gave him a second chance. I think that sometimes in life it is right to give someone a second chance.'' Mr David Cameron insisted that Mr Andy Coulson was doing his job

It could be that Eric Schmidt wants a break from being the main public face of the company,'' he said. Danny Sullivan noted that Eric Schmidt had come in for criticism for awkward recent statements which had been harmful to Google's reputation and the three top executives may have decided`` it was time for a fresh public face.'' Max Clifford , the well-known public relations guru who reportedly received a lucrative settlement when his phones were tapped, said that Edmonson's firing and Andy Coulson 's resignation was like a volcano that is starting to erupt. `` There will be huge explosions all over Fleet Street if police get to the truth,'' he told the BBC. Mr Eric Schmidt , 55, will remain an adviser to Mr Larry Page and Google's other co-founder, Sergey Brin , as Google's executive chairman. The changes come into effect on April 4. In my clear opinion, Larry Page is ready to lead and I'm excited about working with both him and Sergey Brin for a long time to come, Mr Eric Schmidt said.
